channel.title: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Cheating in the Partyhouse?"

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded: And Kagamin has a 10% chance of getting the cheat Ryo back, from my understanding.

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded:
Anon was pointing out the personalities. I meant to post it but he got here before me *shakes fist then laughs*

In the video games with slots Tsunade encourages cheating. (NUN2 she makes you buy her a book that teaches cheating ^_^)

Naruto is a straight kinda guy though so he would prolly be pissed at cheaters.

Plus hey when you have her luck…. you gotta cheat. XD

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded: Yup. Normally, Billy increases your chances of better stuff, while The Rack decreases it. Cheating reverses that.

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded:
Billy doesn't like cheating, he'll negate your hard earned Ryo.

But I heard the Rack encourages it…
I'm not sure though.

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded: yeah considering u have a 1:5 chance of getting uncommon or higher drops just doing 2 rolls a day can really boost ur drops or even ur money if u get lucky enough to get lots of permanent items or blue hairpin pieces. also considering u get a pretty good share of the money u had before looping it really makes it easy getting any item u want from there

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded: It gets pricey really quick, and the amount you pay for cheating goes up 1000 per spin (not per spin you cheat… so if you make 5 normal spins and cheat on the sixth one, it costs an extra 6000). So, when you start off you can only really afford one or two spins. But you only need to score a ninja puppet or war fan to recoup it all, and the super-rares are much easier to find. Also, the money counts towards getting the rack.

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded: Well, considering common prizes are pretty much worthless, and that most of your spins without cheating end up with junk, I think 1k for a guaranteed decent prize is worth it.

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded: Is that worth it? It sounds like it could be but that's a lot of extra cash >.>

item.title: Re: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded: There's a checkbox, you click it. It costs an extra 1000 ryo and my understanding is that you'll only get uncommon or better items (no commons).

item.title: Cheating in the Partyhouse?
item.content:encoded: I've heard that you can cheat at the prize wheel in season 2+. How does that work?
